intro: Lasiosiphon scandens, commonly known as the climbing lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes morning glories and other climbing plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, twining stems that allow it to climb and trail along supports. Its flowers are typically white or pale purple, with five petals and a distinctive spurred shape. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, facilitating its propagation in suitable habitats.
